column1: Smoque BBQ////There's just something about less-than-kosher Chicago restaurants operated by Jews; maybe it's true love that drives them to the forbidden fruit
column2: or maybe it requires a necessary dealing with the devil to get into the business
column4: my fellow tribal Chicagoans do excellent things with treyf. First Hot Doug's
column5: and now Smoque. We arrived at ~7:40 PM on a Thursday
column6: and the line was just barely out the door
column7: which is always a good sign. Our food was ready before 8:10; despite the sea of humanity in this establishment
column8: you still probably eat quicker after entry than at a sit-down BBQ restaurant.
